newsitem.title: UK: BA plane crashlands at Manchester, all safe--BBC.
newsitem.headline: BA plane crashlands at Manchester, all safe--BBC.

text.p: A British Airways passenger plane crash-landed at Manchester airport on Sunday after the undercarriage failed but none of the 70 people on board was injured, the British Broadcasting Corporation reported.
The BBC said the British Aerospace ATP twin-propeller airliner was forced to land after the captain reported an emergency. All on board evacuated safely once the plane came to a halt.
A British Airways spokeswoman contacted by telephone said she could not immediately comment since she was in the process of receiving information on the incident.
The BBC said the plane was on its way to Knock in Ireland when the emergency occurred. It did not say where the plane had taken off from.
